channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Iranian Armed Forces says if US retaliates, Iran's response 'will be stronger and more crushing'
Analysis: Iran's strikes seem intended to avoid US deaths. Here's why that might be the case
item.description: Iran's missile strikes against bases in Iraq housing American troops early Wednesday were not an act designed to kill the most Americans possible.

item.title: No initial reports of any US or Iraqi casualties, sources say
item.description: Iran fired a number of missiles at two Iraqi bases housing US troops Wednesday in retaliation for the American strike that killed a top Iranian general last week. The early morning attack presents President Donald Trump with the biggest test of his presidency to date.

item.title: Iran's supreme leader: US got slap in the face
item.description: An undated video released by Iran's semi-official news agency shows Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei praising the missile attacks on a Iraqi base that is home to US troops.

item.title: Analysis: Trump faces choice after Iran attack: To escalate or not
item.description: Iran's defiant volley of ballistic missile attacks on Iraqi bases hosting American forces significantly quickened a cycle of escalation that threatens to erupt into a full blown war with the United States.

item.title: Trump tweets message of optimism following Iran's attacks
item.description: CNN's Chris Cuomo and Rep. Mike Rogers (R-AL) discuss President Donald Trump's optimistic tweet following Iran's attacks on Iraqi military bases where US troops are stationed.

item.title: A look at the most significant weapons in the US military arsenal
item.description: With almost 3 million service members, 4,800 defense sites on seven continents and an annual budget of more than $700 billion, the US military is considered the world's premier fighting force.

item.title: Senator has a warning for Iranians
item.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC) appeared on Fox News saying that the Iranian attack on the Iraqi base that houses US military personnel was "an act of war" and that President Donald Trump had all the authority needed to retaliate.

item.title: Here's what you need to know about the military bases targeted
item.description: Two Iraqi bases that house American troops were the target of more than a dozen Iranian missiles on Wednesday in retaliation for the US killing Iran's most powerful military general.

item.title: 176 dead after plane crashes in Tehran. Iran refuses to hand over black boxes to US
Passengers onboard crashed plane in Iran hailed from around the world
item.description: The 176 victims onboard the Ukraine International Airlines flight that crashed after takeoff from Tehran on Wednesday hailed from various countries around the world.

item.title: Major airlines divert flights from Iranian airspace after missile attacks
item.description: Major international airlines have begun diverting flights from Iranian airspace after Iran fired more than a dozen missiles at two Iraqi military bases that house US forces.

item.title: Video appears to show missiles hit air base in Iraq
item.description: Video from Iran's Fars news appears to show the moment missiles land on the al-Asad air base in Iraq, which houses US troops. CNN cannot independently verify this video.

item.title: The Fox factor: How Trump's favorite network could guide his Iran policy
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: Opinion: The price of Trumpian chaos
item.description: The crisis the world feared when President Donald Trump was elected president is upon us.

item.title: Analysis: Chaos and surprise emerge as crises threaten Trump
item.description: The chaotic aftermath of the US strike against Iran and a shock turn in Donald Trump's impeachment drama are triggering a monumental Capitol Hill clash over trust and presidential power.

item.title: Opinion: What happened to Nikki Haley?
item.description: How much has Trumpism broken the GOP? Just look at Nikki Haley, once considered a reasonable-ish conservative and a fresh Republican face, someone with a reputation for standing up to the bully-in-chief. The former South Carolina governor and UN ambassador trumpeted a message of civility and persuasion, for a few minutes there, arguing not so long ago that name-calling and accusations don't win arguments; mutually respectful discussions do.

item.title: Top Facebook exec: Yes, we got Trump elected and it may happen again
item.description: A Facebook executive who backed Hillary Clinton's 2016 election campaign told colleagues in an internal memo last month that the platform could ultimately be responsible for President Trump's reelection.

item.title: Carlos Ghosn speaks out after fleeing from Japan
Opinion: McConnell bested Pelosi and Schumer on impeachment
item.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer have been bested by Mitch McConnell yet again. The two Democrats attempted to create impeachment leverage where none existed by withholding the Articles of Impeachment passed last month against President Donald Trump.

item.title: Stephen Colbert throws shade on Trump impeachment news
item.description: Late-night hosts Stephen Colbert and Trevor Noah weigh in on former Trump National Security Adviser John Bolton saying he was prepared to testify if the Senate issued a subpoena for his testimony in the President's impeachment trial.

item.title: Pelosi: McConnell should 'immediately' publish impeachment resolution
item.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Tuesday called for Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to "immediately" publish the resolution detailing the rules for the Senate impeachment trial of President Donald Trump, saying that step had to be taken before the impeachment articles would be sent to the Senate.

item.title: Estranged husband of missing mom Jennifer Dulos faces murder charges
item.description: Almost eight months after Jennifer Farber Dulos disappeared, her estranged husband and his ex-girlfriend face charges related to her death.

item.title: Video shows hundreds of animals died trying to flee Australia fires
item.description: Wildfires raking Australia's New South Wales may have killed millions of animals. Video from rural Batlow shows animals that died trying to escape the flames.

item.title: California is suing a Silicon Valley billionaire for blocking public access to a beach
item.description: For nearly a century, people flocked to Martin's Beach, a picturesque stretch of sand just south of Half Moon Bay in the San Francisco Bay Area, to swim, surf and dig their toes into the sand.

item.title: Photo of Donald Trump Jr. holding a rifle raises flags with hate group researchers
item.description: A photo of President Donald Trump's oldest son smiling while holding a semi-automatic rifle bearing medieval symbols and a cartoon of Hillary Clinton behind bars drew swift attention over the weekend, with hate group researchers pointing out that the medieval symbols have been embraced by extremist groups.

item.title: Kentucky judge suspended after alleged affair and nepotism
item.description: A Kentucky judge was suspended with pay pending an investigation into accusations of misconduct including, among others, nepotism, retaliation against local government employees, and having an affair with a man and a woman in a courthouse office, court documents show.

item.title: There's a new Girl Scout cookie in town
item.description: It's the most wonderful time of the year!

item.title: Army dad surprises daughter at school. Her reaction is priceless
item.description: US Army Chief Warrant Officer Jason Wayt surprised his daughter at her school after not seeing his family for over a year while he was deployed in Syria. CNN affiliate WTVY reports.

item.title: Fitness startup ClassPass is now a unicorn
item.description: ClassPass has muscled its way into the $1 billion startup club.

item.title: Brad Pitt's 'happy place' is highly relatable
item.description: Brad Pitt's had a rough few years.

item.title: Tom Hanks' son baffles internet with accent
item.description: Tom Hanks' son Chet sparked internet commentary when he posted an Instagram video of him speaking in a Caribbean accent at the Golden Globes.

item.title: Hundreds of students without updated vaccination records may be excluded from school, district says
Their son was beaten to death while visiting Greece. They hope a second trial will finally bring justice
Serena Williams, Roger Federer and Rafa Nadal commit to Australian bushfires charity match
Deadly earthquake has most of Puerto Rico with no power, no water and residents fear more destruction
See massive tuna sold for $1.8 million
item.description: Kiyoshi Kimura, a self-described "Tuna King," spent a staggering sum on a bluefin tuna at Tokyo's Toyosu fish market.

item.title: US cancer death rate sees largest-ever single-year drop, report says
item.description: The rate of people dying from cancer in the United States continued to decline for the 26th year in a row, according to a new American Cancer Society report.

item.title: Lifestyle changes may combat a dementia that strikes people in their 40s and 50s
item.description: Frontotemporal dementia strikes early, typically in the 50s, sometimes as young as age 45. Unlike Alzheimer's, it doesn't affect memory, instead attacking the parts of the brain which control thinking, reasoning and emotions.

item.title: Study: Alcohol-related deaths have doubled in the US and women are at an increased risk
This secret can help you live to 100
item.description: CNN's Chief Medical Correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta explains how Ikigai can help you live to 100.

item.title: Experts say the keto diet isn't sustainable, so why is it so popular?
item.description: America is in the midst of a keto craze. The trendy diet -- which bans carbs to make your body burn fat for fuel -- has kicked Weight Watchers' derrière on the stock market, captured the endorsement of celebrities such as Kourtney Kardashian and Halle Berry, and deluged the internet with recipes and copious social media chatter about pounds lost.

item.title: Allergic to dogs? It may only be the males
item.description: Love dogs but find yourself uncontrollably sneezing around some of them? There might be a solution that's easier than allergy shots. Neuter your male pup or opt for a female dog.

item.title: Astronomers discover giant wave-shaped structure in the Milky Way
item.description: Our solar system resides in one of the Milky Way galaxy's spiral arms, and for the first time, astronomers have realized we're close to a giant wave-shaped gaseous structure that connects star nurseries.

item.title: Astronaut shares stunning image from space
item.description: NASA astronaut Christina Koch posted a dazzling image of the Quadrantid meteor shower -- the first meteor shower of 2020 -- with a tweet saying the shooting stars could be seen from space.

item.title: Hubble peeks at 'Godzilla galaxy'
item.description: In April, the Hubble Space Telescope will celebrate 30 years of exploring the space around us and sharing new discoveries, along with awe-inspiring views. And its latest subject is a galaxy thought to be the largest in the local universe: the so-called "Godzilla galaxy."

item.title: TESS mission spots 'Tatooine' system and Earth-size potentially habitable planet
item.description: NASA's planet-hunting mission TESS has found its first potentially habitable exoplanet the size of Earth orbiting a star about 100 light-years from Earth, according to the agency.

item.title: Glacier National Park is replacing signs that predicted its glaciers would be gone by 2020
item.description: The signs at Glacier National Park warning that its signature glaciers would be gone by 2020 are being changed.

item.title: Pat Sajak's daughter to help host 'Wheel of Fortune'
item.description: "Wheel of Fortune" has a special guest on its docket this week.

item.title: Elon Musk busts a move at Tesla event
item.description: Watch Elon Musk dance on stage during a Tesla event at the company's factory in Shanghai.

item.title: World's first 350km/hour driverless bullet train goes into service
item.description: China has just hurtled past another milestone in its vast high-speed railway expansion plans.

item.title: Bluetooth is about to get its most important update in 20 years
item.description: Bluetooth will soon roll out some of the technology's biggest improvements in its nearly 20-year history.

item.title: Warren Buffett has $130 billion in cash. He's looking for a deal
item.description: Warren Buffett wants to make a big acquisition -- and the Oracle of Omaha's Berkshire Hathaway conglomerate has nearly $130 billion in cash that he can use in a deal. But what would Buffett deem worthy of buying at a time when stocks remain near record highs?

item.title: Privacy is the star at CES this year
item.description: Forget the headless cat robots, vertical TVs and automated trash cans. The hottest product at this year's CES technology conference may just be privacy.

item.title: Anthropologist: Why Trump's threat is unthinkable
item.description: Over the weekend, President Trump twice tweeted out threats to attack sites that are important to "Iranian culture." Since then, Trump appeared to walk back his comments somewhat, and Secretary of Defense Mark Esper has suggested that the US would make no such attacks, stating that the country would follow "the laws of armed conflict."

item.title: The three subversive messages of 'Schitt's Creek'
item.description: In 'Schitt's Creek,' Daniel Levy gives us an example of what life in a small North American town could look like if people valued respect and kindness over money and power.

item.title: Swalwell: Why Trump can't be trusted on Iran
item.description: The US airstrike that killed Iranian Maj. Gen. Qasem Soleimani in Baghdad lacked two key elements that any American military strategy must have: the trust of the American people and allies to back us up.

item.title: Weinstein case shows the courts have caught up to #MeToo
item.description: On the eve of Harvey Weinstein's criminal trial in New York for felony charges on two counts of predatory sexual assault, two counts of rape and one count of a criminal sexual act, he's been charged in Los Angeles with forcible rape and sexual battery, among other serious violent sex crimes. If convicted of the charges in the LA complaint, which stem from two alleged encounters with separate victims on consecutive nights in 2013, he faces up to 28 years in prison. Weinstein will be expected to appear in court in LA to face the charges upon the conclusion of his New York trial.

item.title: Eliot's letters are a misogynist reminder
item.description: "Emily Hale would have killed the poet in me."

item.title: The Methodist schism is sad but justified
item.description: A diverse group of leaders in the United Methodist Church proposed a plan last Friday to split the church into two denominations. If the plan is approved by delegates to the church's general conference this May, the main body of the United Methodist Church would recognize the dignity of LGBTQ people, and a new "traditionalist" Methodist denomination would peel off to continue in a separate branch what they see as the "tradition" of exclusion, banning same sex marriage and LGBTQ people from the clergy.

item.title: The bombshell Trump's team didn't want revealed
item.description: The praise or condemnation President Donald Trump is drawing for the latest US actions in the Middle East in no way diminishes the power of the legal bombshell that just exploded in the United States with new evidence of his behavior regarding Ukraine.

item.title: Refinance today and you could save $23,000
9 cards charging 0% interest until 2021
The one stock for the death of the iPhone
Police in Australia are accusing 24 people of deliberately setting bushfires
500 earthquakes rattle Puerto Rico region in 10 days. More may be coming.
item.description: A 6.4 magnitude earthquake that killed one person in Puerto Rico on Tuesday is one of hundreds of tremors that have rattled the island for more than a week. And experts say the shaking is not over yet.

item.title: Four men ordered to hang for fatal gang rape on New Delhi bus
item.description: Four men have been issued with death warrants for the brutal gang rape of a 23-year-old physiotherapy student in New Delhi more than seven years ago.

item.title: Two Mississippi men arrested for allegedly trying to cash in a fake $100,000 scratch-off ticket
item.description: Two men in Mississippi were arrested for allegedly attempting to pass off a lottery ticket that had been altered to show the winning numbers, authorities said.

item.title: Ten injured, two seriously, after 18-wheeler crashes into school bus in North Carolina, fire chief says
item.description: Eight children were hospitalized, at least two of them in serious condition, after a tractor-trailer hit a stopped school bus in North Carolina on Tuesday morning, authorities said.
